args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject represents a more specific subtype or category within the broader class represented by the object.
args.justification: All relations describe a taxonomic/class-inclusion link where the subject is a more specific category of the object (e.g., food offerings as a type of grave goods, Egyptian pyramids as a type of ancient Egyptian tomb). This is best modeled as a subtype relation with consistent predicate naming.
Each relation encodes a taxonomic or categorical hierarchy (a more specific funerary/tomb category included within a broader one), so they belong to the same class of taxonomic hierarchy relations.
Subtype/supertype (is-a) hierarchies are a form of identity/typing relation, linking a more specific identity to a more general one, so they fit best in an IDENTITY-oriented high-level group.

Subtype/supertype (is-a) hierarchies are a form of identity/typing relation, linking a more specific identity to a more general one, so they fit best in an IDENTITY-oriented high-level group.
